item.title: Units and measurements
item.description: Introduction Properties For a system one can define properties that describe the system in some sense. For example consider the system of the display you are reading this on. This system has many qualitative characteristics such as how large it is, how luminous it is, how often it refreshes the displayed image etc. Some of these system properties are also measurable: A system property is measurable if by using a reproducible process, one can associate it with a real number.
